noun.description: A large, thin, flat case for loose sheets of paper such as drawings or maps.
A range of investments held by a person or organization.
examples: better returns on its investment portfolio

noun.description: The position and duties of a minister of state or a member of a cabinet.
examples: he took on the Foreign Affairs portfolio

adjective.description: Relating to, denoting, or engaged in an employment pattern that involves a succession of short-term contracts and part-time work, rather than the more traditional model of a long-term single job.
examples: portfolio careers allow women to balance work with family

origin: Early 18th century: from Italian portafogli, from portare carry + foglio leaf (from Latin folium).
